result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell Glen Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

Absolute sobriety.
No possession or use of drugs without a prescription or drug paraphernalia. 
Not to have contact with known users/dealers except as necessary for treatment or in a confinement setting. 
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. 
Not to possess counterfeit money.
No contact with Dresser Food & Liquor.
No contact with DCKW or their property at 2120 200th Avenue. 
No contact with JWC or their property at 676 200th Street County Road M, Osceola. 
No contact with KDK, MJT, JRL or NRC.

Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

Complete any programming required by agent and follow recommendations.

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

records.addlTxt: Atty Taber
re Jail Credit
DNA Submission Acknowledgment Form

22CF320, 22CF186, 21CF158, 22CF93, 22CF94, 21CF554, 21CF579  11:02 AM Defendant Mitchell Glen Anderson in court, in custody.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Dan Firkus appeared by video for Mitchell Glen Anderson. Attorney Renee Taber appeared in person for Mitchell Glen Anderson.  DE agrees with Branch 2 handling sentencing.  Atty Firkus agrees with going forward.  Parties waive PSI.  Ct puts JR on the record.  ADA Webster agrees.  Atty Taber agrees.  May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.  CT goes over PQWR.  

22CF186: DE pleads G to Count 1 as repeater, but striking 2nd enhancer of certain places on file 22CF186. DE pleads G to Count 2 on file 22CF186. 22CF94: DE pleads G to Count 1 and Count 8 in file 22CF94. 21CF158: DE pleads G to Count 1 on file 21CF158.  CT finds DE FVI&K enters pleas on each count and accepts pleas.  Ct finds DE G and enters judgment on each count.  Waives PSI.  Ct finds DE FVI&K waives PSI.  Ct - All other counts on all other files RI&D w/prej and w/o costs.  ADA Webster addresses Ct.  Atty Taber addresses Ct.  Ct grants 30 days to Atty Taber to calculate jail credit.  Atty Firkus addresses Ct.  

SENTENCING: 

21CF158 - Count 1 Misdm Theft.  $200 DNA SC, fine/costs of $265.60. W/H - Probation 2 years.  

22CF94 - Count 1 W/H sentence - 3 years probation.  $250 DNA SC, fine/costs of $290.60.  
Count 8 Misdm Theft - W/H sentence - 2 years probation.  $200 DNA SC, fine/costs waived.  

22CF186 - W/H 3 years probation.  Count 1 - $250 DNA SC, fine/costs of $300.05.  6 months conditional JT, Subj to WR, not subj to GT, stayed for use of probation.  Restitution to Dresser Food & Liquor $60, plus 10% SC, plus 5% SC for COC.  All fines and costs are a condition of probation, but payable to COC.  Set up PP with COC within 60 days, civil judgement, collections and TI.   Absolute sobriety.  AODA assessment and follow-through. Not to have contact with: Dresser Food & Liquor.  Not to have contact with: DCKW or her property at 2120 200th Avenue.  Not to have contact with: KDK, MJT, JRL, & NRC.  Not to have contact with: JWC or her property at 676 200th Street, County Rd M, Osceola.  Not to possess counterfeit money.  Not to operate motor vehicle w/o valid DL.  Not to possess or use drugs without a prescription or drug paraphernalia. No contact with know users and dealers accept in confined setting or treatment setting.  Follow through with probation.  DE to give true and accurate statements to LE.  

Count 2 - $250 DNA SC, fine/costs waived. 
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.  PCR given. 11:57 adj.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

21CF579 - ARGN: Reading waived, plea NG.

CASES: PH in 21CF554, 21CF579, 22CF93, 22CF94. 09:34 AM. JL-Clerk. Defendant Mitchell Glen Anderson in court with attorney Renee M Taber.  Defendant Mitchell Glen Anderson in custody.  Benjamin James Webster appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
22CF93: State calls Officer McLain - S&T. CT finds identification made. State requests CT take JN of bonds in Polk Co Cases 21CF579, 21CF554, 21CF158. CT takes JN of bonds. Cross by Atty Taber. CT finds PC, Def bound over for trial. 
21CF554: State calls Deputy Neumann - S&T. State requests CT take JN of bonds in Polk Co Case 21CF158 and St. Croix Co Cases 21CF237, 21CF160, 21CF128, & 20CF938. CT takes JN of bonds. Atty Taber makes objection to testimony. State requests continuance if CT sustains objection. CT - sustained, continuance of PH in this matter granted. 
22CF94: State calls Deputy Neumann, already under oath. State requests CT take JN of bonds in Polk Co Cases 21CF579, 21CF554, 21CF158. CT takes JN of bonds. CT finds identification made. Cross by Atty Taber. CT finds PC, Def bound over for trial. 
21CF579: State calls Deputy Neumann, already under oath. CT finds identification made. State req CT take JN of bond in 21CF158. CT takes JN of bond. Cross by Atty Taber. CT finds PC, Def bound over for trial. 
22CF93/22CF94 motion for bond modification:  Atty Taber motions for bond modification. State objects to bond modification. CT does not modify bond. 
Bonds cont. 10:41 am adj.  Arraignment scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Renee Taber
